comments.body:
Complication: outer references now need to have correct type arguments where previously a TypeRef was enough.

Actually, this likely fixes errors that went undetected before, because we should have updated the refinements of outer references but didn't (casts can hide such errors all too conveniently).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +161,165 @@   *  @param  name   The name of the outer access
   *  @param  flags  The flags of the outer accessor
   *
   * The type of the outer accessor is computed as follows:
   * Let O[X1, .., Xn] be the class enclosing `cls`.

comments.body: This val could be moved in the else branch of `val target`.

diffHunk:

    val outerThis = owner.owner.enclosingClass.thisType
    val outerCls = cls.owner.enclosingClass
    val target =

comments.body: Since this is somewhat subtle, I would add a comment here that restates what is in the commit message.
